alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 17 at 1:20PM AKST until December 20 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Snow occurring with additional snowfall of 1 to 3 inches through 3 pm Saturday. Plan on slippery road conditions. Heavy snow and blowing snow possible beginning Sunday with a slight chance of freezing rain. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, with localized amounts up to 12 inches, are possible. * WHERE...Central Interior. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory through 3 PM Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Look for reduced visibilities at times. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
